sn48.50:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Aṅgas, near the Aṅgan town called Āpaṇa.
sn48.50:4.3: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta:
sn48.50:4.4: “Sāriputta, would a noble disciple who is sure and confident in the Realized One have any doubt or uncertainty about the Realized One or his instructions?”
sn48.50:5.1: “Sir, a noble disciple who is sure and confident in the Realized One would have no doubt or uncertainty about the Realized One or his instructions.
sn48.50:5.2: You can expect that a faithful noble disciple will live with energy roused up
sn48.50:5.3: for giving up unwholesome qualities and gaining wholesome qualities. They’re strong, firmly applied, not slacking off when it comes to developing wholesome qualities.
sn48.50:5.4: For their energy is the faculty of energy.
sn48.50:6.1: You can expect that a faithful and energetic noble disciple will be mindful, with utmost mindfulness and alertness, able to remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
sn48.50:6.2: For their mindfulness is the faculty of mindfulness.
sn48.50:7.1: You can expect that a faithful, energetic, and mindful noble disciple will, relying on letting go, get samādhi, get unification of mind.
sn48.50:7.2: For their samādhi is the faculty of samādhi.
sn48.50:8.1: You can expect that a faithful, energetic, mindful noble disciple with their mind in samādhi will understand this:
sn48.50:8.4: But when that dark mass of ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, that state is peaceful and sublime.
sn48.50:8.5: That is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.’
sn48.50:8.6: For their noble wisdom is the faculty of wisdom.
sn48.50:9.1: When a noble disciple has tried again and again, recollected again and again, entered samādhi again and again, and understood with wisdom  again and again, they will be confident of this:
sn48.50:9.2: ‘I have previously heard of these things.
sn48.50:9.3: But now I have direct meditative experience of them, and see them with penetrating wisdom.’
sn48.50:9.4: For their faith is the faculty of faith.”
sn48.50:10.2: “Sāriputta, a noble disciple who is sure and confident in the Realized One would have no doubt or uncertainty about the Realized One or his instructions. …”
sn48.50:10.3: (The Buddha then repeated Sāriputta’s answer word for word.)
